snippet: Peruvian officials have not shared the results of tests to determine why dolphins and seabirds are dying, causing some to fear there is more to the story.
abstract: Peruvian government has yet to conclusively pinpoint cause of mass deaths of dolphins and seabirds and has failed to release definitive results from tests on the animals; some scientists argue that the deaths could be attributable to offshore oil exploration, while other fear that biotoxins or pesticides may be making their way up the food chain.

byline.original: By DAVID JOLLY and ANDREA ZARATE
byline.contributor: David Jolly reported from Paris, and Andrea Zarate from Lima, Peru.

lead_paragraph: Peruvian officials have not shared the results of tests to determine why dolphins and seabirds are dying, causing some to fear there is more to the story.

headline.seo: Peru Has No Answers on Dead Dolphins and Seabirds
headline.main: Dead Dolphins and Birds Are Causing Alarm in Peru
headline.print_headline: Dead Dolphins and Birds Are Causing Alarm in Peru
